lead_paragraph: Interviews with voters showed that many were steadfast in their support of Mr. Trump, but his crude remarks about the armed services clearly present an obstacle.

byline.contributor: Alexander Burns reported from Portsmouth, Nick Corasaniti from Jacksonville Beach, Fla., and Noah Remnick from Tucson and Colorado Springs. Ashley Parker contributed reporting from Virginia Beach.
byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS, NOAH REMNICK and NICK CORASANITI

headline.print_headline: Trump Risks Alienating Military Voters He Needs
headline.main: Donald Trump Risks Alienating Military Communities in Swing States

snippet: Interviews with voters showed that many were steadfast in their support of Mr. Trump, but his crude remarks about the armed services clearly present an obstacle....
abstract: Donald Trump's frequent and repeated clashes with Khizr and Ghazala Khan, parents of slain Marine Capt Humayuhn Khan, have reignited controversies surrounding statements he has made about armed services; controversies have dismayed many in military communities across country, alienating integral constituency in many swing states.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
